com.davidbracewell.reflection

Class Reflect

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.davidbracewell.reflection.Reflect

  • public final class Reflect
extends Object
    Allows fluent use of reflection
    Author:
    David B. Bracewell

      • on

        public static Reflect on(@NonNull
                         Constructor constructor,
                         boolean allowPrivilegedAccess,
                         Object... args)
                  throws ReflectionException
        Creates an instance Reflect for an object that gets constructed using the supplied constructor and arguments.
        Parameters:
        constructor - The constructor to call
        allowPrivilegedAccess - Allows access to all methods on the object or class
        args - The arguments to pass to the constructor
        Returns:
        A Reflect wrapper around the constructed object
        Throws:
        ReflectionException - Something went wrong constructing the object

      • on

        public static Reflect on(@NonNull
                         Method method,
                         Object owner,
                         boolean allowPrivilegedAccess,
                         Object... args)
                  throws ReflectionException
        Creates an instance Reflect for an object returned by invoking a method.
        Parameters:
        method - The method to call
        owner - The object to call the method on (null for static)
        allowPrivilegedAccess - Allows access to all methods on the object or class
        args - The arguments to pass to the constructor
        Returns:
        A Reflect wrapper around the constructed object
        Throws:
        ReflectionException - Something went wrong invoking the method

      • containsField

        public boolean containsField(String name)
        Determines if a field with the given name is associated with the class
        Parameters:
        name - The field name
        Returns:
        True if there is a field with the given name

      • allowPrivilegedAccess

        public Reflect allowPrivilegedAccess()
        Allow privileged access.
        Returns:
        An new Reflect object based on the current one that allows privileged access to methods, fields, and constructors.

      • get

        public <T> T get()
        Get t.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The object type
        Returns:
        The object used in reflection or null if there is not one

        Gets reflected class.
        Returns:

      • create

        public Reflect create()
               throws ReflectionException
        Creates an instance of the class being reflected using the no-argument constructor.
        Returns:
        A Reflect object to do further reflection
        Throws:
        ReflectionException - Something went wrong constructing the object

      • create

        public Reflect create(Object... args)
               throws ReflectionException
        Creates an instance of the class being reflected using the most specific constructor available.
        Parameters:
        args - The arguments to the constructor.
        Returns:
        A Reflect object to do further reflection
        Throws:
        ReflectionException - Something went wrong constructing the object

      • invoke

        public Reflect invoke(String methodName,
                      Object... args)
               throws ReflectionException
        Invokes a method with a given name and arguments with the most specific method possible
        Parameters:
        methodName - The name of the method
        args - The arguments to the method
        Returns:
        A Reflect object representing the results

      • set

        public Reflect set(String fieldName,
                   Object value)
            throws ReflectionException
        Sets the value of a field. Will perform conversion on the value if needed.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - The name of the field to set
        value - The value to set the field to
        Returns:
        This instance of Reflect
        Throws:
        ReflectionException - Something went wrong setting the value of field

      • get

        public Reflect get(@NonNull
                   String fieldName)
            throws ReflectionException
        Gets the value of a field.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - The name of the field to get
        Returns:
        An instance of Reflect wrapping the result of the field value
        Throws:
        ReflectionException - Something went wrong getting the value of field
